ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to direct actors, implement a vision for a production, organize and communicate with a production team, analyze a text, and design with lighting and sets.

The name of this course is perfect because it's definitely what I feel I gathered, a practical approach to directing. I feel as though I gained other tools to add to my director's toolbox and will begin implementing them immediately.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought there was a really nice array of activities. Every session was jam-packed. I would suggest a five day on, one day off structure to prevent Zoom fatigue if this course was held online again in the future.
Lack of people of color teaching. The plays selected could've had more diversity. More time getting to know our classmates would be nice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, this provides a great foundation for directing and is pretty inspirational overall.
Definitely. I came away with better knowledge of directing and would suggest anyone take the course.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
